jobDescription: this job Overview How have you impacted someone's life today? At Meridian Health our teams are focused on changing the lives of our patients by providing the highest level of care each and every day. From our hospitals, rehab centers and occupational health teams to our long-term care centers and at-home care capabilities, our complete spectrum of services will allow you to apply your skills in multiple settings while building your career, all within New Jersey's premier healthcare system. The Nurse Scientist designs and implements collaborative investigator initiated studies and/or projects. Acts as a consultant for interdisciplinary research projects and with the Center for Evidence Based Care. Supports grant acquisition and execution and conducts special projects. Responsibilities A day in the life of a Nurse Scientist at Meridian includes: Conducting all phases of research and evaluation Assisting in data analysis and evaluation of the ITEAM HRSA Grant Qualifications Current and valid NJ Nursing License is required Masters Degree is required Doctoral degree in nursing or a related field is required Grant writing and evaluation experience is required Strong research background is required Excellent mentoring skills required Highly motivated, creative individual If you feel that the above description speaks directly to your strengths and capabilities, then please apply today!
